summary: Talking Heads was an American rock band formed in 1975 in New York City. The band members were David Byrne, Chris Frantz, Tina Weymouth, and Jerry Harrison. They were known for their unique sound, blending punk, art rock, funk, and world music. Talking Heads became popular in the 1980s with hits like "Burning Down the House." They released several acclaimed albums and a concert film, *Stop Making Sense*. The band broke up in 1991 but was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2002.
title: Talking Heads
